thread.title: No. 17 Lady Knights move to 13-0 in district play with sweep
thread.title_full: No. 17 Lady Knights move to 13-0 in district play with sweep

author: EVAN GRICE Sports Editor
title: No. 17 Lady Knights move to 13-0 in district play with sweep
text:
Staff photo by Evan Grice Setting it up 
Lindsay Lady Knights player Ashley Fleitman sets up a kill attempt during the second set of a district matchup against Saint Jo Friday afternoon. Fleitman finished with a team-high 37 assists for the Lady Knights. Posted: Saturday, October 24, 2015 12:20 am No. 17 Lady Knights move to 13-0 in district play with sweep By EVAN GRICE Sports Editor   
LINDSAY - While the weather outside Friday afternoon might have been frightful, the No. 17 Lindsay Lady Knights were playing some delightful volleyball inside Knights Gymnasium. 
LHS put the polish on their newly won ninth straight district title, with a commanding 25-7, 25-15, 25-5 sweep over the Saint Jo Lady Panthers. 
With the victory the Lady Knights moved to 31-8 overall and 13-0 in district play, one win away from another perfect district run. 
Lindsay will have its chance to finish off in style Tuesday night as the Lady Knights host Prairie Valley at 7 p.m. 
As for the contest against the Lady Panthers, Jocelyn Grewing led the offense with 13 kills to go with four aces, with Sarah Snider registering 10 kills. 
Erin Early finished with nine kills to go with four aces and four digs, while Makenzie Fleitman totaled eight kills and three digs. 
Ashley Fleitman totaled a team-high 37 assists, to go with two digs, three blocks, three kills and four aces in the match. 
Morgan McClure also had three kills, to go with two digs. 
Scout Tatum finished with a team high 10 digs, with Hannah Davis added two digs, while Sydney McCage added four digs. 
Valley View 3 Tioga 1 
Speaking of another team that is playoff bound, the Valley View Lady Eagles got a measure of revenge Friday afternoon, as they took out the Tigoa Lady Bulldogs by scores of 14-25, 25-23, 25-18, and 25-20. 
Lauren Bierschenk finished with 19 kills, 14 digs and 22 assists, with Savanna Schneiderjan totaling 15 kills to go with 19 assists. 
Madison Heskett finished with three kills to go with five aces, five assists and 10 digs in the match. 
Marlow Sappington finished with a team-high 25 digs in the match. 
Valley View will finish up district play Tuesday night on the road against Collinsville. 
Whitesboro 3 Pilot Point 0 
In a game that could only be classified as a must win game, the Whitesboro Lady Bearcats came through when it mattered most Friday afternoon on the road. 
WHS swept the Lady Bearcats from Pilot Point 25-15, 25-8, 25-22 to keep their slim playoff hopes alive. 
Whitesboro (23-15, 7-6) will finish district play Tuesday night at home against Howe, knowing if they win and finish tied with Ponder, they will win the fourth and final playoff spot by virtue of owning the tiebreaker over the Lady Lions. 
Jess Abney led the offense for Whitesboro with 10 kills and 15 assists, with Delani Dickson adding nine kills and two digs. 
Phoenix West added eight kills and five digs, with Lauren Purdom and Taylor Bown each putting in five kills apiece. 
Casey Lang added a team-high 16 assists to go with six digs, while Molly Miller added 16 digs. 
Carissa Clark and Jacklynn Cogburn added seven and six digs respectively. 
Karlee Schuessler added two kills and two digs. 
Gunter 3 Callisburg 0 
It was a good news, bad news scenario for the No. 16 Callisburg Lady Wildcats Friday afternoon at No. 3 Gunter. 
The bad news was the Lady Wildcats missed out on a chance at revenge and were swept 25-19, 25-14, 25-19. 
However, the good news is that the Lady Wildcats will enter the final week of district play tied with Pottsboro for the second seed in the playoffs, knowing that a win against Ponder at home and a Lady Cardinals loss to Gunter Tuesday night will secure them the second seed. 
Mikayla Watson led the Lady Tigers with 20 kills in the match to go with 19 digs. 
Callisburg will be hosting senior night Tuesday at home against Ponder with matches set to begin at 4:30 p.m. 
Argyle 3 Gainesville 0 
For the Gainesville Lady Leopards volleyball team, time is quickly running out on them getting their first district win of the season. 
Friday afternoon saw the Lady Leopards face the No. 2 Argyle Lady Eagles on the road, as GHS was swept 25-9, 25-12, and 25-11. 
Gainesville will finish the season with a home game against Sanger Tuesday night with matches set to begin at 5 p.m.
